title: R44430
content: The Office on Violence Against Women (OVW) administers programs under the Violence Against Women Act (VAWA) of 1994, providing financial and technical assistance to improve criminal justice responses to domestic violence, dating violence, sexual assault, and stalking. The Obama Administration's FY2017 request for OVW was $489 million, slightly higher than the FY2016 appropriation of $480 million, with a proposed transfer of $326 million from the Crime Victims Fund. The Obama Administration proposed transferring $326 million from the Crime Victims Fund to the Office on Violence Against Women (OVW) in their FY2017 request. They also requested increases for various grants to combat domestic violence, including grants for arrests in domestic violence cases, civil legal assistance, violence on college campuses, abuse against the elderly, and tribal justice systems' response to domestic violence on tribal lands. Additionally, they proposed funding two new initiatives to reduce firearm lethality.
